2000.context: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. is a semiconductor company designing CPUs, GPUs, and data center chips focused on processors for PCs, gaming, data centers, and embedded systems. Athlon processors challenging Intel. Acquired ATI for graphics. PC market still growing.

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Primary CPU competitor. Dominant position in microprocessor market. AMD competed with successful Athlon processors (launched 1999)

competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: Major competitor in graphics processor market. AMD not yet in GPU market at this time

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: Competitor in semiconductor and processor space

competitors.name: Analog Devices
competitors.notes: Competitor in semiconductor market

competitors.name: Synaptics
competitors.notes: Competitor in semiconductor market

2005.context: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. is a semiconductor company designing CPUs, GPUs, and data center chips focused on processors for PCs, gaming, data centers, and embedded systems. Launched dual-core Athlon 64 X2. Acquired ATI Technologies for $5.4B to compete in graphics.

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Primary CPU competitor. Intel had Pentium 4 and Pentium D processors. AMD released first dual-core Opteron (April 2005) and Athlon 64 X2 (May 2005)

competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: GPU market competitor (AMD not yet in GPU market). NVIDIA dominated graphics cards

competitors.name: ATI Technologies
competitors.notes: GPU market competitor. Major graphics card manufacturer that AMD would acquire in 2006

2010.context: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. is a semiconductor company designing CPUs, GPUs, and data center chips focused on processors for PCs, gaming, data centers, and embedded systems. Struggling financially while Intel dominated. Spun off manufacturing as GlobalFoundries.

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Primary CPU competitor. Intel's Core series processors held significant lead in performance and efficiency. Intel's Core 2 Quads outperformed AMD's Phenom II

competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: Primary GPU competitor. Released GTX 480, GTX 470, GTX 465, and successful GTX 460 1GB. Unveiled DirectX 11 Fermi architecture in March 2010

2015.context: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. is a semiconductor company designing CPUs, GPUs, and data center chips focused on processors for PCs, gaming, data centers, and embedded systems. Near-bankruptcy before Zen architecture development. Stock under $2. Leadership transition.

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Dominant CPU competitor (Goliath to AMD's David). Released Skylake architecture. Intel i5 considered much stronger than AMD FX-8350 for gaming

competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: Primary GPU competitor. Released 4 new GPUs in 2015. Key products: GTX 750 Ti, GTX 950, GTX 960, GTX 970, GTX 980, GTX 980 Ti (great success, ultra high-end performance at accessible price)

2020.context: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. is a semiconductor company designing CPUs, GPUs, and data center chips focused on processors for PCs, gaming, data centers, and embedded systems. Ryzen and EPYC success story. Data center wins against Intel. Announced Xilinx acquisition.

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Primary CPU competitor. Established CPU powerhouse with Core and Xeon lines. Strong in single-threaded applications. AMD's Ryzen processors offered strong multi-threading performance

competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: Primary GPU competitor and global leader in GPU technology. Released RTX 3080 (Sept 2020), RTX 3070 (Oct 2020) with Ampere architecture, featuring real-time ray tracing and AI-powered DLSS

2024.context: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. is a semiconductor company designing CPUs, GPUs, and data center chips focused on processors for PCs, gaming, data centers, and embedded systems. AI chip demand surge with MI300. Competing with Nvidia for AI accelerators. Intel struggling.

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: Primary CPU competitor. AMD's Ryzen 7 9800X3D is fastest gaming chip, beating Intel's Core i9-14900K by 30% and Core Ultra 9 285K by 35%. AMD won Best Overall CPU and Best Gaming CPU for 2024

competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: Primary GPU competitor and AI/data center leader. Controls ~80% of AI accelerator market due to CUDA software dominance. AMD emerging as #2 in data center GPUs but NVIDIA's software lead remains major challenge

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: Competitor in mobile processors and semiconductor space

competitors.name: ARM Holdings
competitors.notes: Competitor in processor architecture and design

competitors.name: MediaTek
competitors.notes: Emerging competitor in semiconductor and processor market

competitors.name: VIA Technologies
competitors.notes: Competitor in semiconductor and processor market

2025.context: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. is a semiconductor company designing CPUs, GPUs, and data center chips focused on processors for PCs, gaming, data centers, and embedded systems. Major AI and data center growth. Integrated Xilinx FPGA technology. PC and gaming strong.

competitors.name: Intel
competitors.notes: AMD's most significant and long-standing competitor since 1981 in the x86 microprocessor market. Competes in personal computer and server markets, though AMD has been gaining market share with competitive performance in gaming and data centers.

competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: GPU market leader with a $5 trillion valuation as of late October 2025. Dominates in gaming, AI, and data center markets. NVIDIA has maintained GPU market leadership for over two decades and is also working on CPU designs that could compete with AMD.

competitors.name: TSMC (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company)
competitors.notes: Leading semiconductor manufacturer that produces chips for AMD and competitors. While also a manufacturing partner, TSMC competes in foundry business and invests heavily in R&D to stay at the forefront of manufacturing technology.

competitors.name: Samsung Electronics
competitors.notes: Competes with TSMC and Intel in the foundry business line and manufactures chips for AMD. Also develops its own semiconductor solutions competing across multiple markets.

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: Major competitor in mobile processors and emerging markets. Competes in the semiconductor space with specialized chips for communications and mobile devices.

competitors.name: Broadcom
competitors.notes: Semiconductor and infrastructure software company, one of the world's largest chip manufacturers specializing in communications and networking chips. Partner with OpenAI for AI silicon development.

competitors.name: Google (Tensor processors)
competitors.notes: Designing custom AI silicon with Tensor processors, competing in the AI chip market where AMD is expanding its presence.

competitors.name: Amazon, Apple, Meta
competitors.notes: Tech giants designing their own AI silicon, creating competition in the AI chip market where AMD is targeting growth and market share expansion.

mentionedBy.name: Arm Holdings plc
mentionedBy.notes: Rising x86 competitor with Zen architecture

mentionedBy.name: Arm Holdings plc
mentionedBy.notes: x86 competitor gaining data center share

mentionedBy.name: Arm Holdings plc
mentionedBy.notes: x86 competitor, also licensing ARM for some products

mentionedBy.name: Broadcom Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Competitor in semiconductor solutions for data centers and computing

mentionedBy.name: Broadcom Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Semiconductor competitor in AI chips, data center processors, and GPUs

mentionedBy.name: Broadcom Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Major AI and data center competitor; stock up 70% in 2025 vs Broadcom's 45% gain; trades at similar P/E multiples (AMD 32x vs AVGO 33.5x)

mentionedBy.name: Intel Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Primary competitor with Athlon processors competing against Pentium III and Pentium 4; gained significant market share

mentionedBy.name: Intel Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Leading semiconductor competitor; filed unfair competition claims in 2004-2005

mentionedBy.name: Intel Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Leading semiconductor competitor; Intel had ~90% PC microprocessor market share

mentionedBy.name: Intel Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Intel's biggest competitor in x86 microprocessor market; top x86 manufacturer second to Intel

mentionedBy.name: Intel Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Main competitor with Zen microarchitecture; revenue surged 45% to $9.76B, profits up 630% in 2020

mentionedBy.name: Intel Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Long-time CPU rival with Ryzen and EPYC processors; gained market share with high-performance alternatives

mentionedBy.name: Intel Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Leading competitor in CPUs, GPUs, and semiconductor components for computing, gaming, and data centers. AMD has gained significant market share with Ryzen processors offering competitive performance at lower costs. AMD wins the 2025 CPU face-off with victories in five categories compared to Intel's three, with phenomenal gaming performance gains.

mentionedBy.name: NVIDIA Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Competitor in chip realm, acquired ATI in 2006

mentionedBy.name: NVIDIA Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Primary competitor in discrete graphics cards

mentionedBy.name: NVIDIA Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Closest competitor, big AI chip orders from Microsoft, Meta, OpenAI

mentionedBy.name: NVIDIA Corporation
mentionedBy.notes: Primary GPU competitor with Radeon line for PC graphics and Instinct accelerators for data centers. Radeon RX 9000 Series (RDNA 4) targets gamers and creators. Preparing Instinct MI450 series (2026) on CDNA 5 architecture with TSMC 2nm process.
